derivation: a prolonged form of an apparently primary verb (, to slur);
strongs_def: for which another prolonged form () is used as an alternate in some tenses (unless indeed it be identical with the base of G3686 (ὀνίνημι) through the idea of notoriety); to gratify, i.e. (middle voice) to derive pleasure or advantage from
outline:
1. to be useful, to profit, help
  2. to receive profit or advantage, be helped [or have joy]
